H0.text: where is the food stored in a yam plant. Underground stem

H1.text: where is the food stored in a yam plant. Leaf axils

H2.text: where is the food stored in a yam plant. Roots

H3.text: where is the food stored in a yam plant. an edible tuber

A4.text: Stem tubers manifest as thickened rhizomes (underground stems) or stolons (horizontal connections between organisms); examples include the potato and yam.

A5.text: The term root tuber describes modified lateral roots, as in sweet potato, cassava, and dahlia.
